# The `ConstantExpr` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

A constant value that is initialized with an expression using other constant values. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

<CodeBlock>class llvm::ConstantExpr</CodeBlock>

## Description {#details}

A constant value that is initialized with an expression using other constant values.

This class uses the standard <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> opcodes to define the various constant expressions. The Opcode field for the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantexpr">ConstantExpr</a> class is maintained in the Value::SubclassData field.

Definition at line 1108 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constants-h">Constants.h</a>.

### getAsInstruction() {#af9fc0080b4accc0b19bfbbc624701e30}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Instruction &#42; ConstantExpr::getAsInstruction () const</>}>
Returns an <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> which implements the same operation as this <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantexpr">ConstantExpr</a>.

It is not inserted into any basic block.

A better approach to this could be to have a constructor for <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> which would take a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantexpr">ConstantExpr</a> parameter, but that would have spread implementation details of <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantexpr">ConstantExpr</a> outside of <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/constants-cpp">Constants.cpp</a>, which would make it harder to remove ConstantExprs altogether.

### getWithOperands() {#aab577cba8223fe4bb96df5591d49d98a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Constant &#42; ConstantExpr::getWithOperands (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constant">Constant</a> &#42; &gt; Ops, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42; Ty, bool OnlyIfReduced=false, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42; SrcTy=nullptr) const</>}>
Get the current expression with the operands replaced.

Return the current constant expression with the operands replaced with <code>Ops</code> and the type with <code>Ty</code>. The new operands must have the same number as the current ones.

If <code>OnlyIfReduced</code> is <code>true</code>, nullptr will be returned unless something gets constant-folded, the type changes, or the expression is otherwise canonicalized. This parameter should almost always be <code>false</code>.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constants-h/#l01350">1350</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constants-h">Constants.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/constants-cpp/#l01547">1547</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/constants-cpp">Constants.cpp</a>.

### getBinOpAbsorber() {#a47f9877ae06a287965eb7a7432e4c566}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Constant &#42; ConstantExpr::getBinOpAbsorber (unsigned Opcode, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42; Ty, bool AllowLHSConstant=false)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Return the absorbing element for the given binary operation, i.e.

a constant C such that X op C = C and C op X = C for every X. For example, this returns zero for integer multiplication. If AllowLHSConstant is true, the LHS operand is a constant C that must be defined as C op X = C. It returns null if the operator doesn&#39;t have an absorbing element.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constants-h/#l01216">1216</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constants-h">Constants.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/constants-cpp/#l02763">2763</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/constants-cpp">Constants.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getBinOpIdentity() {#ae9c2f00a962cb8e0316cf3548a5d8029}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Constant &#42; ConstantExpr::getBinOpIdentity (unsigned Opcode, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42; Ty, bool AllowRHSConstant=false, bool NSZ=false)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Return the identity constant for a binary opcode.

If the binop is not commutative, callers can acquire the operand 1 identity constant by setting AllowRHSConstant to true. For example, any shift has a zero identity constant for operand 1: X shift 0 = X. If this is a fadd/fsub operation and we don&#39;t care about signed zeros, then setting NSZ to true returns the identity +0.0 instead of -0.0. Return nullptr if the operator does not have an identity constant.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constants-h/#l01198">1198</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constants-h">Constants.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/constants-cpp/#l02692">2692</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/constants-cpp">Constants.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getGetElementPtr() {#ae4d4490a35a575d97166684fb15f8662}

### getIdentity() {#a36c28152478b62574128ad29088aea08}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Constant &#42; ConstantExpr::getIdentity (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; I, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42; Ty, bool AllowRHSConstant=false, bool NSZ=false)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Return the identity constant for a binary or intrinsic <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a>.

The identity constant C is defined as X op C = X and C op X = X where C and X are the first two operands, and the operation is commutative.
